topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5373dff363687240448d0300#post_5373dff363687240448d0300

Throughly disagree

-Code Geass: The mechas are not important to the plot. They are only militarty equipment. You can substitute them with tanks, choppers, etc. and the story would remain unaffected.

-Evangelion: Same as CG; It dwells more about the pshycological effects and pressure of teenagers with traumatic backstories when faced against monsters that have the purpose of bringing the apocalypse and how they react to it, using the mechas as vehicles for those reactions.

-Gurren Laggan: If anything, Gurren Laggan should give you an idea about how the rest of those mecha series would be. GL is a _homage_, it's not meant to encompass everything great from the genre, just the stuff that must diehard fans will recognize and in enough dosis that newcomers can get into, and then get into other series if they feel like it.

I smell 4chan shenanigans.

"@Background Pony #C7EB":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5373ea2d63687224e9730100#post_5373ea2d63687224e9730100
It is from 4chan (Also Hiding behind an Anon banner is a cowards way out, If you're always an anon, Then I apologize)
